00040 
00041 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00042 
00043 #include <linux/kthread.h>
00044 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00045 #include "tracefile.h"
00046 
00047 struct lc_watchdog {
00048         spinlock_t              lcw_lock;       /* check or change lcw_list */
00049         int                     lcw_refcount;   /* must hold lcw_pending_timers_lock */
00050         struct timer_list       lcw_timer;      /* kernel timer */
00051         struct list_head        lcw_list;       /* chain on pending list */
00052         cfs_time_t              lcw_last_touched;/* last touched stamp */
00053         struct task_struct     *lcw_task;       /* owner task */
00054         void                    (*lcw_callback)(pid_t, void *);
00055         void                    *lcw_data;
00056 
00057         pid_t                   lcw_pid;
00058 
00059         enum {
00060                 LC_WATCHDOG_DISABLED,
00061                 LC_WATCHDOG_ENABLED,
00062                 LC_WATCHDOG_EXPIRED
00063         } lcw_state;
00064 };
00065 
00066 #ifdef WITH_WATCHDOG
00067 /*
00068  * The dispatcher will complete lcw_start_completion when it starts,
00069  * and lcw_stop_completion when it exits.
00070  * Wake lcw_event_waitq to signal timer callback dispatches.
00071  */
00072 static struct completion lcw_start_completion;
00073 static struct completion  lcw_stop_completion;
00074 static wait_queue_head_t lcw_event_waitq;
00075 
00076 /*
00077  * Set this and wake lcw_event_waitq to stop the dispatcher.
00078  */
00079 enum {
00080         LCW_FLAG_STOP = 0
00081 };
00082 static unsigned long lcw_flags = 0;
00083 
00084 /*
00085  * Number of outstanding watchdogs.
00086  * When it hits 1, we start the dispatcher.
00087  * When it hits 0, we stop the dispatcher.
00088  */
00089 static __u32         lcw_refcount = 0;
00090 static DEFINE_MUTEX(lcw_refcount_mutex);
00091 
00092 /*
00093  * List of timers that have fired that need their callbacks run by the
00094  * dispatcher.
00095  */
00096 /* BH lock! */
00097 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00098 static struct list_head lcw_pending_timers = LIST_HEAD_INIT(lcw_pending_timers);
00099 
00100 /* Last time a watchdog expired */
00101 static cfs_time_t lcw_last_watchdog_time;
00102 static int lcw_recent_watchdog_count;
00103 
00104 static void
00105 lcw_dump(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00106 {
00107         ENTRY;
00108         rcu_read_lock();
00109        if (lcw->lcw_task == NULL) {
00110                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Process " LPPID " was not found in the task "
00111                               "list; watchdog callback may be incomplete\n",
00112                               (int)lcw->lcw_pid);
00113         } else {
00114                 libcfs_debug_dumpstack(lcw->lcw_task);
00115         }
00116 
00117         rcu_read_unlock();
00118         EXIT;
00119 }
00120 
00121 static void lcw_cb(ulong_ptr_t data)
00122 {
00123         struct lc_watchdog *lcw = (struct lc_watchdog *)data;
00124         ENTRY;
00125 
00126         if (lcw->lcw_state != LC_WATCHDOG_ENABLED) {
00127                 EXIT;
00128                 return;
00129         }
00130 
00131         lcw->lcw_state = LC_WATCHDOG_EXPIRED;
00132 
00133         spin_lock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00134         LASSERT(list_empty(&lcw->lcw_list));
00135 
00136         spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00137         lcw->lcw_refcount++; /* +1 for pending list */
00138         list_add(&lcw->lcw_list, &lcw_pending_timers);
00139         wake_up(&lcw_event_waitq);
00140 
00141         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00142         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00143         EXIT;
00144 }
00145 
00146 static int is_watchdog_fired(void)
00147 {
00148         int rc;
00149 
00150         if (test_bit(LCW_FLAG_STOP, &lcw_flags))
00151                 return 1;
00152 
00153         spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00154         rc = !list_empty(&lcw_pending_timers);
00155         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00156         return rc;
00157 }
00158 
00159 static void lcw_dump_stack(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00160 {
00161         cfs_time_t      current_time;
00162         cfs_duration_t  delta_time;
00163         struct timeval  timediff;
00164 
00165         current_time = cfs_time_current();
00166         delta_time = cfs_time_sub(current_time, lcw->lcw_last_touched);
00167         cfs_duration_usec(delta_time, &timediff);
00168 
00169         /*
00170          * Check to see if we should throttle the watchdog timer to avoid
00171          * too many dumps going to the console thus triggering an NMI.
00172          */
00173         delta_time = cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_sub(current_time,
00174                                                    lcw_last_watchdog_time));
00175 
00176         if (delta_time < libcfs_watchdog_ratelimit &&
00177             lcw_recent_watchdog_count > 3) {
00178                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Service thread pid %u was inactive for "
00179                               "%lu.%.02lus. Watchdog stack traces are limited "
00180                               "to 3 per %d seconds, skipping this one.\n",
00181                               (int)lcw->lcw_pid,
00182                               timediff.tv_sec,
00183                               timediff.tv_usec / 10000,
00184                               libcfs_watchdog_ratelimit);
00185         } else {
00186                 if (delta_time < libcfs_watchdog_ratelimit) {
00187                         lcw_recent_watchdog_count++;
00188                 } else {
00189                         memcpy(&lcw_last_watchdog_time, &current_time,
00190                                sizeof(current_time));
00191                         lcw_recent_watchdog_count = 0;
00192                 }
00193 
00194                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Service thread pid %u was inactive for "
00195                               "%lu.%.02lus. The thread might be hung, or it "
00196                               "might only be slow and will resume later. "
00197                               "Dumping the stack trace for debugging purposes:"
00198                               "\n",
00199                               (int)lcw->lcw_pid,
00200                               timediff.tv_sec,
00201                               timediff.tv_usec / 10000);
00202                 lcw_dump(lcw);
00203         }
00204 }
00205 
00206 /*
00207  * Provided watchdog handlers
00208  */
00209 
00210 static void lc_watchdog_dumplog(pid_t pid, void *data)
00211 {
00212         libcfs_debug_dumplog_internal((void *)((long_ptr_t)pid));
00213 }
00214 
00215 static int lcw_dispatch_main(void *data)
00216 {
00217         int                 rc = 0;
00218         struct lc_watchdog *lcw;
00219         struct list_head zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
00220 
00221         ENTRY;
00222 
00223         complete(&lcw_start_completion);
00224 
00225         while (1) {
00226                 int dumplog = 1;
00227 
00228                 rc = wait_event_interruptible(lcw_event_waitq,
00229                                               is_watchdog_fired());
00230                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Watchdog got woken up...\n");
00231                 if (test_bit(LCW_FLAG_STOP, &lcw_flags)) {
00232                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "LCW_FLAG_STOP set, shutting down...\n");
00233 
00234                         spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00235                         rc = !list_empty(&lcw_pending_timers);
00236                         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00237                         if (rc) {
00238                                 CERROR("pending timers list was not empty at "
00239                                        "time of watchdog dispatch shutdown\n");
00240                         }
00241                         break;
00242                 }
00243 
00244                 spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00245                 while (!list_empty(&lcw_pending_timers)) {
00246                         int is_dumplog;
00247 
00248                         lcw = list_entry(lcw_pending_timers.next,
00249                                          struct lc_watchdog, lcw_list);
00250                         /* +1 ref for callback to make sure lwc wouldn't be
00251                          * deleted after releasing lcw_pending_timers_lock */
00252                         lcw->lcw_refcount++;
00253                         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00254 
00255                         /* lock ordering */
00256                         spin_lock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00257                         spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00258 
00259                         if (list_empty(&lcw->lcw_list)) {
00260                                 /* already removed from pending list */
00261                                 lcw->lcw_refcount--; /* -1 ref for callback */
00262                                 if (lcw->lcw_refcount == 0)
00263                                         list_add(&lcw->lcw_list, &zombies);
00264                                 spin_unlock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00265                                 /* still hold lcw_pending_timers_lock */
00266                                 continue;
00267                         }
00268 
00269                         list_del_init(&lcw->lcw_list);
00270                         lcw->lcw_refcount--; /* -1 ref for pending list */
00271 
00272                         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00273                         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00274 
00275                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "found lcw for pid " LPPID "\n",
00276                                lcw->lcw_pid);
00277                         lcw_dump_stack(lcw);
00278 
00279                         is_dumplog = lcw->lcw_callback == lc_watchdog_dumplog;
00280                         if (lcw->lcw_state != LC_WATCHDOG_DISABLED &&
00281                             (dumplog || !is_dumplog)) {
00282                                 lcw->lcw_callback(lcw->lcw_pid, lcw->lcw_data);
00283                                 if (dumplog && is_dumplog)
00284                                         dumplog = 0;
00285                         }
00286 
00287                         spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00288                         lcw->lcw_refcount--; /* -1 ref for callback */
00289                         if (lcw->lcw_refcount == 0)
00290                                 list_add(&lcw->lcw_list, &zombies);
00291                 }
00292                 spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00293 
00294                 while (!list_empty(&zombies)) {
00295                         lcw = list_entry(zombies.next,
00296                                              struct lc_watchdog, lcw_list);
00297                         list_del_init(&lcw->lcw_list);
00298                         LIBCFS_FREE(lcw, sizeof(*lcw));
00299                 }
00300         }
00301 
00302         complete(&lcw_stop_completion);
00303 
00304         RETURN(rc);
00305 }
00306 
00307 static void lcw_dispatch_start(void)
00308 {
00309         struct task_struct *task;
00310 
00311         ENTRY;
00312         LASSERT(lcw_refcount == 1);
00313 
00314         init_completion(&lcw_stop_completion);
00315         init_completion(&lcw_start_completion);
00316         init_waitqueue_head(&lcw_event_waitq);
00317 
00318         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "starting dispatch thread\n");
00319         task = kthread_run(lcw_dispatch_main, NULL, "lc_watchdogd");
00320         if (IS_ERR(task)) {
00321                 CERROR("error spawning watchdog dispatch thread: %ld\n",
00322                         PTR_ERR(task));
00323                 EXIT;
00324                 return;
00325         }
00326         wait_for_completion(&lcw_start_completion);
00327         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "watchdog dispatcher initialization complete.\n");
00328 
00329         EXIT;
00330 }
00331 
00332 static void lcw_dispatch_stop(void)
00333 {
00334         ENTRY;
00335         LASSERT(lcw_refcount == 0);
00336 
00337         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "trying to stop watchdog dispatcher.\n");
00338 
00339         set_bit(LCW_FLAG_STOP, &lcw_flags);
00340         wake_up(&lcw_event_waitq);
00341 
00342         wait_for_completion(&lcw_stop_completion);
00343 
00344         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "watchdog dispatcher has shut down.\n");
00345 
00346         EXIT;
00347 }
00348 
00349 struct lc_watchdog *lc_watchdog_add(int timeout,
00350                                     void (*callback)(pid_t, void *),
00351                                     void *data)
00352 {
00353         struct lc_watchdog *lcw = NULL;
00354         ENTRY;
00355 
00356         LIBCFS_ALLOC(lcw, sizeof(*lcw));
00357         if (lcw == NULL) {
00358                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Could not allocate new lc_watchdog\n");
00359                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00360         }
00361 
00362         spin_lock_init(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00363         lcw->lcw_refcount = 1; /* refcount for owner */
00364         lcw->lcw_task     = current;
00365         lcw->lcw_pid      = current_pid();
00366         lcw->lcw_callback = (callback != NULL) ? callback : lc_watchdog_dumplog;
00367         lcw->lcw_data     = data;
00368         lcw->lcw_state    = LC_WATCHDOG_DISABLED;
00369 
00370         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lcw->lcw_list);
00371         cfs_timer_init(&lcw->lcw_timer, lcw_cb, lcw);
00372 
00373         mutex_lock(&lcw_refcount_mutex);
00374         if (++lcw_refcount == 1)
00375                 lcw_dispatch_start();
00376         mutex_unlock(&lcw_refcount_mutex);
00377 
00378         /* Keep this working in case we enable them by default */
00379         if (lcw->lcw_state == LC_WATCHDOG_ENABLED) {
00380                 lcw->lcw_last_touched = cfs_time_current();
00381                 cfs_timer_arm(&lcw->lcw_timer, cfs_time_seconds(timeout) +
00382                               cfs_time_current());
00383         }
00384 
00385         RETURN(lcw);
00386 }
00387 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_add);
00388 
00389 static void lcw_update_time(struct lc_watchdog *lcw, const char *message)
00390 {
00391         cfs_time_t newtime = cfs_time_current();
00392 
00393         if (lcw->lcw_state == LC_WATCHDOG_EXPIRED) {
00394                 struct timeval timediff;
00395                 cfs_time_t delta_time = cfs_time_sub(newtime,
00396                                                      lcw->lcw_last_touched);
00397                 cfs_duration_usec(delta_time, &timediff);
00398 
00399                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Service thread pid %u %s after %lu.%.02lus. "
00400                               "This indicates the system was overloaded (too "
00401                               "many service threads, or there were not enough "
00402                               "hardware resources).\n",
00403                               lcw->lcw_pid,
00404                               message,
00405                               timediff.tv_sec,
00406                               timediff.tv_usec / 10000);
00407         }
00408         lcw->lcw_last_touched = newtime;
00409 }
00410 
00411 static void lc_watchdog_del_pending(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00412 {
00413         spin_lock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00414         if (unlikely(!list_empty(&lcw->lcw_list))) {
00415                 spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00416                 list_del_init(&lcw->lcw_list);
00417                 lcw->lcw_refcount--; /* -1 ref for pending list */
00418                 spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00419         }
00420 
00421         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00422 }
00423 
00424 void lc_watchdog_touch(struct lc_watchdog *lcw, int timeout)
00425 {
00426         ENTRY;
00427         LASSERT(lcw != NULL);
00428 
00429         lc_watchdog_del_pending(lcw);
00430 
00431         lcw_update_time(lcw, "resumed");
00432 
00433         cfs_timer_arm(&lcw->lcw_timer, cfs_time_current() +
00434                       cfs_time_seconds(timeout));
00435         lcw->lcw_state = LC_WATCHDOG_ENABLED;
00436 
00437         EXIT;
00438 }
00439 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_touch);
00440 
00441 void lc_watchdog_disable(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00442 {
00443         ENTRY;
00444         LASSERT(lcw != NULL);
00445 
00446         lc_watchdog_del_pending(lcw);
00447 
00448         lcw_update_time(lcw, "completed");
00449         lcw->lcw_state = LC_WATCHDOG_DISABLED;
00450 
00451         EXIT;
00452 }
00453 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_disable);
00454 
00455 void lc_watchdog_delete(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00456 {
00457         int dead;
00458 
00459         ENTRY;
00460         LASSERT(lcw != NULL);
00461 
00462         cfs_timer_disarm(&lcw->lcw_timer);
00463 
00464         lcw_update_time(lcw, "stopped");
00465 
00466         spin_lock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00467         spin_lock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00468         if (unlikely(!list_empty(&lcw->lcw_list))) {
00469                 list_del_init(&lcw->lcw_list);
00470                 lcw->lcw_refcount--; /* -1 ref for pending list */
00471         }
00472 
00473         lcw->lcw_refcount--; /* -1 ref for owner */
00474         dead = lcw->lcw_refcount == 0;
00475         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw_pending_timers_lock);
00476         spin_unlock_bh(&lcw->lcw_lock);
00477 
00478         if (dead)
00479                 LIBCFS_FREE(lcw, sizeof(*lcw));
00480 
00481         mutex_lock(&lcw_refcount_mutex);
00482         if (--lcw_refcount == 0)
00483                 lcw_dispatch_stop();
00484         mutex_unlock(&lcw_refcount_mutex);
00485 
00486         EXIT;
00487 }
00488 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_delete);
00489 
00490 #else   /* !defined(WITH_WATCHDOG) */
00491 
00492 struct lc_watchdog *lc_watchdog_add(int timeout,
00493                                     void (*callback)(pid_t pid, void *),
00494                                     void *data)
00495 {
00496         static struct lc_watchdog      watchdog;
00497         return &watchdog;
00498 }
00499 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_add);
00500 
00501 void lc_watchdog_touch(struct lc_watchdog *lcw, int timeout)
00502 {
00503 }
00504 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_touch);
00505 
00506 void lc_watchdog_disable(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00507 {
00508 }
00509 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_disable);
00510 
00511 void lc_watchdog_delete(struct lc_watchdog *lcw)
00512 {
00513 }
00514 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lc_watchdog_delete);
00515 
00516 #endif
